heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The lightning strike count peaked at 23 on 07 September 2025, the highest since recording started on 11 April 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 07 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (191°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1754 miles.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.7°C) and outside temperature (down 2.5°C) and drier conditions in outside humidity (down 10%) and rainfall (down 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (down 8 mbar).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 2.2°C) and feels like temperature (up 3.5°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 1001.5m higher than yesterday, 779.7m higher than the past week, 90.2m higher than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 1181m and a high of 2400m, averaging 2600m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: Expect mostly clear skies with high cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; warm but comfortable temperatures are expected. Also, humidity should not be a concern and calm and still conditions are expected. Drizzle or light rain possible, mostly clear skies with high cloud, and sunlight levels will peak at very high intensity. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
